chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,
items.plainText: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

items.text: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
items.plainText: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.

items.text: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
items.plainText: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

items.text: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou canst tell?
items.plainText: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou canst tell?

items.text: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
items.plainText: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

items.text: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
items.plainText: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

items.text: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:
items.plainText: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:

items.text: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
items.plainText: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

items.text: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.
items.plainText: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.

items.text: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
items.plainText: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

items.text: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
items.plainText: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

items.text: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
items.plainText: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

items.text: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
items.plainText: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

items.text: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
items.plainText: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

items.text: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:
items.plainText: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:

items.text: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
items.plainText: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

items.text: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
items.plainText: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

items.text: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
items.plainText: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

items.text: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
items.plainText: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

items.text: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
items.plainText: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

items.text: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:
items.plainText: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:

items.text: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;
items.plainText: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

items.text: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
items.plainText: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

items.text: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
items.plainText: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

items.text: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
items.plainText: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

items.text: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;
items.plainText: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

items.text: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
items.plainText: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

items.text: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.
items.plainText: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.

items.text: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:
items.plainText: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

items.text: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
items.plainText: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

items.text: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.
items.plainText: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

items.text: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
items.plainText: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

items.text: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
items.plainText: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
